message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CE, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with off-policy evaluation and optimization with batch data from bandit feedback, which is a problem commonly studied in the machine learning community. The use of contextual bandit algorithms and counterfactual policies suggests a focus on reinforcement learning and decision making, which are subfields of machine learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The use of statistical estimators and variance reduction techniques suggests a focus on statistical inference and estimation, which are subfields of statistics. Therefore, cs.ST (Statistics) is also a possible sub-category. The application of the proposed method to improve advertisement design suggests a focus on computational advertising, which is a subfield of computer engineering. Therefore, cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) is another possible sub-category. The use of batch data and offline estimators suggests a focus on data management and analysis, which are subfields of data science. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory) are also possible sub-categories.
